title: MS AccessSecond()Function

metadata.description: Learn about MS AccessSecond()Function with clear explanations and practical examples.

content_sections.title: Details
content_sections.content:
❯
Example
Return the seconds part of a specified time:
SELECT 
  Second(#14:48:23#);

Definition and Usage
The Second() function returns the seconds part of a time/datetime.
This function returns an integer between 0 and 59.
Syntax
Second(
time
)
Parameter Values
Parameter
Description
time
Required. A numeric or string expression that can represent a valid 
    time/datetime
Technical Details
Works in:
From Access 2000
More Examples
Example
Return the seconds part of the current time:
SELECT 
  Second(Now());

Example
Return the seconds part of a specified datetime:
SELECT 
  Second(#24/10/2016 11:18:34 PM#);

❯
★
+1

summary: This tutorial covers MS AccessSecond()Function concepts and techniques. You'll learn how to use MS AccessSecond()Function effectively, including key principles, common patterns, and practical examples. By the end of this tutorial, you'll have a solid understanding of MS AccessSecond()Function and how to apply it in your projects.
